verses.kjv: Saul reigned one year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,
verses.web: Saul was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel forty-two years.
verses.ct: Saul was 30 years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel for 42 years.

verses.kjv: Saul chose him three thousand men of Israel; whereof two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in mount Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.
verses.web: Saul chose for himself three thousand men of Israel, of which two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the Mount of Bethel, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin. He sent the rest of the people to their own tents.
verses.ct: Saul handpicked 3,000 soldiers from Israel. He kept 2,000 with him at Michmash and in the hill country of Bethel, and stationed 1,000 with his son Jonathan at Gibeah in Benjamin. He sent the rest of the army home.

verses.kjv: And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.
verses.web: Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, “Let the Hebrews hear!”
verses.ct: Jonathan attacked the Philistine garrison at Geba and wiped it out. When the Philistines got word of it, Saul had trumpets blown throughout the whole land, declaring, "Let the Hebrews hear!"

verses.kjv: And all Israel heard say that Saul had smitten a garrison of the Philistines, and that Israel also was had in abomination with the Philistines. And the people were called together after Saul to Gilgal.
verses.web: All Israel heard that Saul had struck the garrison of the Philistines, and also that Israel was considered an abomination to the Philistines. The people were gathered together after Saul to Gilgal.
verses.ct: News spread across Israel that Saul had struck down a Philistine garrison — and that Israel had now made itself an enemy the Philistines despised. So the people were summoned to join Saul at Gilgal.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines gathered themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the sea shore in multitude: and they came up, and pitched in Michmash, eastward from Bethaven.
verses.web: The Philistines assembled themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the seashore in multitude. They came up and encamped in Michmash, eastward of Beth Aven.
verses.ct: The Philistines assembled a massive force to fight Israel: 30,000 chariots, 6,000 horsemen, and foot soldiers as countless as sand on the seashore. They marched up and set up camp at Michmash, east of Beth Aven.

verses.kjv: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait, (for the people were distressed,) then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.
verses.web: When the men of Israel saw that they were in trouble (for the people were distressed), then the people hid themselves in caves, in thickets, in rocks, in tombs, and in pits.
verses.ct: When the Israelite men saw how desperate their situation was, they panicked. People hid wherever they could — in caves, in thick brush, among the rocks, in tombs, and in pits.

verses.kjv: And some of the Hebrews went over Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. As for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
verses.web: Now some of the Hebrews had gone over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but as for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
verses.ct: Some Hebrews even crossed the Jordan River and fled to the territory of Gad and Gilead. Saul stayed at Gilgal, but every soldier still with him was shaking with fear.

verses.kjv: And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel had appointed: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.
verses.web: He stayed seven days, according to the time set by Samuel; but Samuel didn’t come to Gilgal, and the people were scattering from him.
verses.ct: Saul waited 7 days — the time Samuel had set for his arrival — but Samuel didn't come to Gilgal, and the troops were starting to slip away.

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Bring hither a burnt offering to me, and peace offerings. And he offered the burnt offering.
verses.web: Saul said, “Bring the burnt offering to me here, and the peace offerings.” He offered the burnt offering.
verses.ct: So Saul said, "Bring me the burnt offering and the peace offerings." And he offered the burnt offering himself.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might salute him.
verses.web: It came to pass that as soon as he had finished offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might greet him.
verses.ct: The moment he finished offering the burnt offering, Samuel arrived. Saul went out to greet him.

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, What hast thou done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that thou camest not within the days appointed, and that the Philistines gathered themselves together at Michmash;
verses.web: Samuel said, “What have you done?” Saul said, “Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that you didn’t come within the days appointed, and that the Philistines assembled themselves together at Michmash;
verses.ct: Samuel demanded, "What have you done?" Saul answered, "I saw the troops scattering, and you hadn't come by the appointed time, and the Philistines were massing at Michmash.

verses.kjv: Therefore said I, The Philistines will come down now upon me to Gilgal, and I have not made supplication unto the LORD: I forced myself therefore, and offered a burnt offering.
verses.web: therefore I said, ‘Now the Philistines will come down on me to Gilgal, and I haven’t entreated the favor of LORD.’ I forced myself therefore, and offered the burnt offering.”
verses.ct: I thought, 'The Philistines are about to attack me here at Gilgal, and I haven't sought the LORD's favor.' So I felt I had no choice — I went ahead and offered the burnt offering."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said to Saul, Thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not kept the commandment of the LORD thy God, which he commanded thee: for now would the LORD have established thy kingdom upon Israel for ever.
verses.web: Samuel said to Saul, “You have done foolishly. You have not kept the commandment of LORD your God, which he commanded you; for now LORD would have established your kingdom on Israel forever.
verses.ct: Samuel told Saul, "You've acted like a fool. You didn't obey the command the LORD your God gave you. If you had, the LORD would have established your kingdom over Israel forever.

verses.kjv: But now thy kingdom shall not continue: the LORD hath sought him a man after his own heart, and the LORD hath commanded him to be captain over his people, because thou hast not kept that which the LORD commanded thee.
verses.web: But now your kingdom will not continue. LORD has sought for himself a man after his own heart, and LORD has appointed him to be prince over his people, because you have not kept that which LORD commanded you.”
verses.ct: But now your kingdom won't last. The LORD has already found a man whose heart is fully devoted to him, and the LORD has appointed him as ruler over his people — because you didn't keep what the LORD commanded you."

verses.kjv: And Samuel arose, and gat him up from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people that were present with him, about six hundred men.
verses.web: Samuel arose, and went from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. Saul counted the people who were present with him, about six hundred men.
verses.ct: Samuel got up and left Gilgal, heading to Gibeah of Benjamin. Saul counted the soldiers still with him — only about 600 men.

verses.kjv: And Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people that were present with them, abode in Gibeah of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
verses.web: Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people who were present with them, stayed in Geba of Benjamin; but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
verses.ct: Saul, his son Jonathan, and the troops who remained with them stayed at Gibeah of Benjamin, while the Philistines held their camp at Michmash.

verses.kjv: And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned unto the way that leadeth to Ophrah, unto the land of Shual:
verses.web: The raiders came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned to the way that leads to Ophrah, to the land of Shual;
verses.ct: Raiding parties began pouring out of the Philistine camp in 3 groups. One headed toward Ophrah in the region of Shual.

verses.kjv: And another company turned the way to Bethhoron: and another company turned to the way of the border that looketh to the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.
verses.web: another company turned the way to Beth Horon; and another company turned the way of the border that looks down on the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.
verses.ct: A second group turned toward Beth Horon, and the third headed toward the border overlooking the valley of Zeboim near the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel: for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears:
verses.web: Now there was no blacksmith found throughout all the land of Israel; for the Philistines said, “Lest the Hebrews make themselves swords or spears”;
verses.ct: There wasn't a single blacksmith in all of Israel, because the Philistines had said, "We can't let the Hebrews make swords or spears."

verses.kjv: But all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his share, and his coulter, and his axe, and his mattock.
verses.web: but all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, each man to sharpen his own plowshare, mattock, ax, and sickle.
verses.ct: So every Israelite had to go down to the Philistines to get their plowshares, mattocks, axes, and sickles sharpened.

verses.kjv: Yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the coulters, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to sharpen the goads.
verses.web: The price was one payim each to sharpen mattocks, plowshares, pitchforks, axes, and goads.
verses.ct: The charge was a payim to sharpen plowshares and mattocks, and a third of a shekel for sharpening axes and straightening goads.

verses.kjv: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people that were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.
verses.web: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that neither sword nor spear was found in the hand of any of the people who were with Saul and Jonathan; but Saul and Jonathan his son had them.
verses.ct: So when the day of battle came, not a single soldier with Saul and Jonathan had a sword or spear — only Saul and Jonathan themselves were armed.

verses.kjv: And the garrison of the Philistines went out to the passage of Michmash.
verses.web: The garrison of the Philistines went out to the pass of Michmash.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a Philistine outpost had moved forward to hold the pass at Michmash.
